trans-unit.source: The core text APIs in the Windows.UI.Text.Core namespace enable a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app to receive text input from any text service supported on Windows devices.
trans-unit.target: The core text APIs in the Windows.UI.Text.Core namespace enable a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app to receive text input from any text service supported on Windows devices.

trans-unit.source: Custom text input overview
trans-unit.target: Custom text input overview

trans-unit.source: Custom text input
trans-unit.target: Custom text input

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: The core text APIs in the [**Windows.UI.Text.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958238) namespace enable a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app to receive text input from any text service supported on Windows devices.
trans-unit.target: The core text APIs in the [**Windows.UI.Text.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958238) namespace enable a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app to receive text input from any text service supported on Windows devices.

trans-unit.source: The APIs are similar to the [Text Services Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms629032) APIs in that the app is not required to have detailed knowledge of the text services.
trans-unit.target: The APIs are similar to the [Text Services Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms629032) APIs in that the app is not required to have detailed knowledge of the text services.

trans-unit.source: This enables the app to receive text in any language and from any input type, like keyboard, speech, or pen.
trans-unit.target: This enables the app to receive text in any language and from any input type, like keyboard, speech, or pen.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Text.Core
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Text.Core

trans-unit.source: CoreTextEditContext
trans-unit.target: CoreTextEditContext

trans-unit.source: Why use core text APIs?
trans-unit.target: Why use core text APIs?

trans-unit.source: For many apps, the XAML or HTML text box controls are sufficient for text input and editing.
trans-unit.target: For many apps, the XAML or HTML text box controls are sufficient for text input and editing.

trans-unit.source: However, if your app handles complex text scenarios, like a word processing app, you might need the flexibility of a custom text edit control.
trans-unit.target: However, if your app handles complex text scenarios, like a word processing app, you might need the flexibility of a custom text edit control.

trans-unit.source: You could use the [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) keyboard APIs to create your text edit control, but these don't provide a way to receive composition-based text input, which is required to support East Asian languages.
trans-unit.target: You could use the [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) keyboard APIs to create your text edit control, but these don't provide a way to receive composition-based text input, which is required to support East Asian languages.

trans-unit.source: Instead, use the [**Windows.UI.Text.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958238) APIs when you need to create a custom text edit control.
trans-unit.target: Instead, use the [**Windows.UI.Text.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958238) APIs when you need to create a custom text edit control.

trans-unit.source: These APIs are designed to give you a lot of flexibility in processing text input, in any language, and let you provide the text experience best suited to your app.
trans-unit.target: These APIs are designed to give you a lot of flexibility in processing text input, in any language, and let you provide the text experience best suited to your app.

trans-unit.source: Text input and edit controls built with the core text APIs can receive text input from all existing text input methods on Windows devices, from [Text Services Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms629032) based Input Method Editors (IMEs) and handwriting on PCs to the WordFlow keyboard (which provides auto-correction, prediction, and dictation) on mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: Text input and edit controls built with the core text APIs can receive text input from all existing text input methods on Windows devices, from [Text Services Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms629032) based Input Method Editors (IMEs) and handwriting on PCs to the WordFlow keyboard (which provides auto-correction, prediction, and dictation) on mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Architecture
trans-unit.target: Architecture

trans-unit.source: The following is a simple representation of the text input system.
trans-unit.target: The following is a simple representation of the text input system.

trans-unit.source: "Application" represents a UWP app hosting a custom edit control built using the core text APIs.
trans-unit.target: "Application" represents a UWP app hosting a custom edit control built using the core text APIs.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.UI.Text.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958238) APIs facilitate the communication with text services through Windows.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.UI.Text.Core**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958238) APIs facilitate the communication with text services through Windows.

trans-unit.source: Communication between the text edit control and the text services is handled primarily through a [**CoreTextEditContext**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958158) object that provides the methods and events to facilitate the communication.
trans-unit.target: Communication between the text edit control and the text services is handled primarily through a [**CoreTextEditContext**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958158) object that provides the methods and events to facilitate the communication.

trans-unit.source: core text architecture diagram
trans-unit.target: core text architecture diagram

trans-unit.source: Text ranges and selection
trans-unit.target: Text ranges and selection

trans-unit.source: Edit controls provide space for text entry and users expect to edit text anywhere in this space.
trans-unit.target: Edit controls provide space for text entry and users expect to edit text anywhere in this space.

trans-unit.source: Here, we explain the text positioning system used by the core text APIs and how ranges and selections are represented in this system.
trans-unit.target: Here, we explain the text positioning system used by the core text APIs and how ranges and selections are represented in this system.

trans-unit.source: Application caret position
trans-unit.target: Application caret position

trans-unit.source: Text ranges used with the core text APIs are expressed in terms of caret positions.
trans-unit.target: Text ranges used with the core text APIs are expressed in terms of caret positions.

trans-unit.source: An "Application Caret Position (ACP)" is a zero-based number that indicates the count of characters from the start of the text stream immediately before the caret, as shown here.
trans-unit.target: An "Application Caret Position (ACP)" is a zero-based number that indicates the count of characters from the start of the text stream immediately before the caret, as shown here.

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram

trans-unit.source: Text ranges and selection
trans-unit.target: Text ranges and selection

trans-unit.source: Text ranges and selections are represented by the [**CoreTextRange**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958201) structure which contains two fields:
trans-unit.target: Text ranges and selections are represented by the [**CoreTextRange**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958201) structure which contains two fields:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Data type
trans-unit.target: Data type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: StartCaretPosition
trans-unit.target: StartCaretPosition

trans-unit.source: **Number** \[JavaScript
trans-unit.target: **Number** \[JavaScript

trans-unit.source: **System.Int32** \[.NET
trans-unit.target: **System.Int32** \[.NET

trans-unit.source: The start position of a range is the ACP immediately before the first character.
trans-unit.target: The start position of a range is the ACP immediately before the first character.

trans-unit.source: EndCaretPosition
trans-unit.target: EndCaretPosition

trans-unit.source: **Number** \[JavaScript
trans-unit.target: **Number** \[JavaScript

trans-unit.source: **System.Int32** \[.NET
trans-unit.target: **System.Int32** \[.NET

trans-unit.source: The end position of a range is the ACP immediately after the last character.
trans-unit.target: The end position of a range is the ACP immediately after the last character.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the text range shown previously, the range \[0, 5\] specifies the word "Hello".
trans-unit.target: For example, in the text range shown previously, the range \[0, 5\] specifies the word "Hello".

trans-unit.source: **StartCaretPosition** must always be less than or equal to the **EndCaretPosition**.
trans-unit.target: **StartCaretPosition** must always be less than or equal to the **EndCaretPosition**.

trans-unit.source: The range \[5, 0\] is invalid.
trans-unit.target: The range \[5, 0\] is invalid.

trans-unit.source: Insertion point
trans-unit.target: Insertion point

trans-unit.source: The current caret position, frequently referred to as the insertion point, is represented by setting the **StartCaretPosition** to be equal to the **EndCaretPosition**.
trans-unit.target: The current caret position, frequently referred to as the insertion point, is represented by setting the **StartCaretPosition** to be equal to the **EndCaretPosition**.

trans-unit.source: Noncontiguous selection
trans-unit.target: Noncontiguous selection

trans-unit.source: Some edit controls support noncontiguous selections.
trans-unit.target: Some edit controls support noncontiguous selections.

trans-unit.source: For example, Microsoft Office apps support multiple arbitrary selections, and many source code editors support column selection.
trans-unit.target: For example, Microsoft Office apps support multiple arbitrary selections, and many source code editors support column selection.

trans-unit.source: However, the core text APIs do not support noncontiguous selections.
trans-unit.target: However, the core text APIs do not support noncontiguous selections.

trans-unit.source: Edit controls must report only a single contiguous selection, most often the active sub-range of the noncontiguous selections.
trans-unit.target: Edit controls must report only a single contiguous selection, most often the active sub-range of the noncontiguous selections.

trans-unit.source: For example, consider this text stream:
trans-unit.target: For example, consider this text stream:

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-2.png) There are two selections: \[0, 1\] and \[6, 11\].
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-2.png) There are two selections: \[0, 1\] and \[6, 11\].

trans-unit.source: The edit control must report only one of them; either \[0, 1\] or \[6, 11\].
trans-unit.target: The edit control must report only one of them; either \[0, 1\] or \[6, 11\].

trans-unit.source: Working with text
trans-unit.target: Working with text

trans-unit.source: The [**CoreTextEditContext**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958158) class enables text flow between Windows and edit controls through the [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event, the [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) event, and the [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172) method.
trans-unit.target: The [**CoreTextEditContext**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958158) class enables text flow between Windows and edit controls through the [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event, the [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) event, and the [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172) method.

trans-unit.source: Your edit control receives text through [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) events that are generated when users interact with text input methods like keyboards, speech, or IMEs.
trans-unit.target: Your edit control receives text through [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) events that are generated when users interact with text input methods like keyboards, speech, or IMEs.

trans-unit.source: When you change text in your edit control, for example, by pasting text into the control, you need to notify Windows by calling [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172).
trans-unit.target: When you change text in your edit control, for example, by pasting text into the control, you need to notify Windows by calling [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172).

trans-unit.source: If the text service requires the new text, then a [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) event is raised.
trans-unit.target: If the text service requires the new text, then a [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) event is raised.

trans-unit.source: You must provide the new text in the **TextRequested** event handler.
trans-unit.target: You must provide the new text in the **TextRequested** event handler.

trans-unit.source: Accepting text updates
trans-unit.target: Accepting text updates

trans-unit.source: Your edit control should typically accept text update requests because they represent the text the user wants to enter.
trans-unit.target: Your edit control should typically accept text update requests because they represent the text the user wants to enter.

trans-unit.source: In the [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event handler, these actions are expected of your edit control:
trans-unit.target: In the [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event handler, these actions are expected of your edit control:

trans-unit.source: Insert the text specified in [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.Text**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958236) in the position specified in [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.Range**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958234).
trans-unit.target: Insert the text specified in [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.Text**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958236) in the position specified in [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.Range**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958234).

trans-unit.source: Place selection at the position specified in [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.NewSelection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958233).
trans-unit.target: Place selection at the position specified in [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.NewSelection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958233).

trans-unit.source: Notify the system that the update succeeded by setting [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.Result**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958235) to [**CoreTextTextUpdatingResult.Succeeded**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958237).
trans-unit.target: Notify the system that the update succeeded by setting [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.Result**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958235) to [**CoreTextTextUpdatingResult.Succeeded**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958237).

trans-unit.source: For example, this is the state of an edit control before the user types "d".
trans-unit.target: For example, this is the state of an edit control before the user types "d".

trans-unit.source: The insertion point is at \[10, 10\].
trans-unit.target: The insertion point is at \[10, 10\].

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-3.png) When the user types "d", a [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event is raised with the following [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958229) data:
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-3.png) When the user types "d", a [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event is raised with the following [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958229) data:

trans-unit.source: [**Range**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958234) = \[10, 10
trans-unit.target: [**Range**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958234) = \[10, 10

trans-unit.source: [**Text**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958236) = "d"
trans-unit.target: [**Text**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958236) = "d"

trans-unit.source: [**NewSelection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958233) = \[11, 11
trans-unit.target: [**NewSelection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958233) = \[11, 11

trans-unit.source: In your edit control, apply the specified changes and set [**Result**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958235) to **Succeeded**.
trans-unit.target: In your edit control, apply the specified changes and set [**Result**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958235) to **Succeeded**.

trans-unit.source: Here's the state of the control after the changes are applied.
trans-unit.target: Here's the state of the control after the changes are applied.

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram

trans-unit.source: Rejecting text updates
trans-unit.target: Rejecting text updates

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, you cannot apply text updates because the requested range is in an area of the edit control that should not be changed.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, you cannot apply text updates because the requested range is in an area of the edit control that should not be changed.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you should not apply any changes.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you should not apply any changes.

trans-unit.source: Instead, notify the system that the update failed by setting [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.Result**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958235) to [**CoreTextTextUpdatingResult.Failed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958237).
trans-unit.target: Instead, notify the system that the update failed by setting [**CoreTextTextUpdatingEventArgs.Result**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958235) to [**CoreTextTextUpdatingResult.Failed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958237).

trans-unit.source: For example, consider an edit control that accepts only an e-mail address.
trans-unit.target: For example, consider an edit control that accepts only an e-mail address.

trans-unit.source: Spaces should be rejected because e-mail addresses cannot contain spaces, so when [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) events are raised for the space key, you should simply set [**Result**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958235) to **Failed** in your edit control.
trans-unit.target: Spaces should be rejected because e-mail addresses cannot contain spaces, so when [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) events are raised for the space key, you should simply set [**Result**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958235) to **Failed** in your edit control.

trans-unit.source: Notifying text changes
trans-unit.target: Notifying text changes

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, your edit control makes changes to text such as when text is pasted or auto-corrected.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, your edit control makes changes to text such as when text is pasted or auto-corrected.

trans-unit.source: In these cases, you must notify the text services of these changes by calling the [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172) method.
trans-unit.target: In these cases, you must notify the text services of these changes by calling the [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172) method.

trans-unit.source: For example, this is the state of an edit control before the user pastes "World".
trans-unit.target: For example, this is the state of an edit control before the user pastes "World".

trans-unit.source: The insertion point is at \[6, 6\].
trans-unit.target: The insertion point is at \[6, 6\].

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-5.png) The user performs the paste action and the edit control ends up with the following text:
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-5.png) The user performs the paste action and the edit control ends up with the following text:

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-4.png) When this happens, you should call [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172) with these arguments:
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-4.png) When this happens, you should call [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172) with these arguments:

trans-unit.source: *modifiedRange* = \[6, 6
trans-unit.target: *modifiedRange* = \[6, 6

trans-unit.source: *newLength* = 5
trans-unit.target: *newLength* = 5

trans-unit.source: *newSelection* = \[11, 11
trans-unit.target: *newSelection* = \[11, 11

trans-unit.source: One or more [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) events will follow, which you handle to update the text that the text services are working with.
trans-unit.target: One or more [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) events will follow, which you handle to update the text that the text services are working with.

trans-unit.source: Overriding text updates
trans-unit.target: Overriding text updates

trans-unit.source: In your edit control, you might want to override a text update to provide auto-correction features.
trans-unit.target: In your edit control, you might want to override a text update to provide auto-correction features.

trans-unit.source: For example, consider an edit control that provides a correction feature that formalizes contractions.
trans-unit.target: For example, consider an edit control that provides a correction feature that formalizes contractions.

trans-unit.source: This is the state of the edit control before the user types the space key to trigger the correction.
trans-unit.target: This is the state of the edit control before the user types the space key to trigger the correction.

trans-unit.source: The insertion point is at \[3, 3\].
trans-unit.target: The insertion point is at \[3, 3\].

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-6.png) The user presses the space key and a corresponding [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event is raised.
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-6.png) The user presses the space key and a corresponding [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event is raised.

trans-unit.source: The edit control accepts the text update.
trans-unit.target: The edit control accepts the text update.

trans-unit.source: This is the state of the edit control for a brief moment before the correction is completed.
trans-unit.target: This is the state of the edit control for a brief moment before the correction is completed.

trans-unit.source: The insertion point is at \[4, 4\].
trans-unit.target: The insertion point is at \[4, 4\].

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-7.png) Outside of the [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event handler, the edit control makes the following correction.
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-7.png) Outside of the [**TextUpdating**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958176) event handler, the edit control makes the following correction.

trans-unit.source: This is the state of the edit control after the correction is complete.
trans-unit.target: This is the state of the edit control after the correction is complete.

trans-unit.source: The insertion point is at \[5, 5\].
trans-unit.target: The insertion point is at \[5, 5\].

trans-unit.source: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-8.png) When this happens, you should call [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172) with these arguments:
trans-unit.target: example text stream diagram](images/coretext/stream-8.png) When this happens, you should call [**NotifyTextChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958172) with these arguments:

trans-unit.source: *modifiedRange* = \[1, 2
trans-unit.target: *modifiedRange* = \[1, 2

trans-unit.source: *newLength* = 2
trans-unit.target: *newLength* = 2

trans-unit.source: *newSelection* = \[5, 5
trans-unit.target: *newSelection* = \[5, 5

trans-unit.source: One or more [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) events will follow, which you handle to update the text that the text services are working with.
trans-unit.target: One or more [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) events will follow, which you handle to update the text that the text services are working with.

trans-unit.source: Providing requested text
trans-unit.target: Providing requested text

trans-unit.source: It's important for text services to have the correct text to provide features like auto-correction or prediction, especially for text that already existed in the edit control, from loading a document, for example, or text that is inserted by the edit control as explained in previous sections.
trans-unit.target: It's important for text services to have the correct text to provide features like auto-correction or prediction, especially for text that already existed in the edit control, from loading a document, for example, or text that is inserted by the edit control as explained in previous sections.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, whenever a [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) event is raised, you must provide the text currently in your edit control for the specified range.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, whenever a [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) event is raised, you must provide the text currently in your edit control for the specified range.

trans-unit.source: There will be times the [**Range**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958227) in [**CoreTextTextRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958221) specifies a range that your edit control cannot accommodate as-is.
trans-unit.target: There will be times the [**Range**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958227) in [**CoreTextTextRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958221) specifies a range that your edit control cannot accommodate as-is.

trans-unit.source: For example, the **Range** is larger than the size of the edit control at the time of the [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) event, or the end of the **Range** is out of bounds.
trans-unit.target: For example, the **Range** is larger than the size of the edit control at the time of the [**TextRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958175) event, or the end of the **Range** is out of bounds.

trans-unit.source: In these cases, you should return whatever range makes sense, which is typically a subset of the requested range.
trans-unit.target: In these cases, you should return whatever range makes sense, which is typically a subset of the requested range.
